title.narrative: Economic and social empowerment of young women and men in western and north-western regions of Zambia

description.narrative:
The joint initiative by UNFPA and UNIDO, in partnership with the Government of Zambia leverages on proven positive correlations between health, education, productivity and economic empowerment of youth in a given context. Evidence generated in Zambia underscores the fact that economic and social development cannot be addressed in silos if Zambia is to achieve its Vision of becoming a prosperous middle income country by 2030. The adoption of an integrated and multi-sectoral development approach by the Government resonates with global consensus on the interconnectedness of health, including Sexual and Reproductive Health (SRH), education, and economic empowerment. Guided by the country context and status of youth in Zambia, the joint initiative in targeted sites, will aim at improving the resilience of youth to health risks and insecurities through integrated health programmes, including SRH, with necessary linkages to education and skills acquisition that will build the social capital and improve productivity of Zambia’s working age population.
The joint initiative aims to improve development outcomes of young women and men, by improving opportunities for productive work for young women and men, while also improving their resilience to health risks and vulnerabilities. Empowering young women and men in strategic industries, and harnessing their economic potential/performances is instrumental to driving local innovation, fostering peer-to-peer support, and addressing health, social and economic challenges in a sustainable and inclusive manner.
In particular, the project will apply an integrated development model that addresses economic and social development of young women and men through entrepreneurship development while simultaneously strengthening their resilience to health risks, particularly SRH. The model thus intervenes horizontally across multiple sectors to ensure beneficiaries are supported in an integrated and holistic manner. This will be achieved by creating an enabling environment for young entrepreneurs, including social entrepreneurs; through (1) policy revision and exchange of good practices to ensure that youth-related issues are addressed in an appropriate and comprehensive manner; by (2) fostering networks, peer-to-peer support, access to information, and access to technology for entrepreneurship development and to support the creation of decent jobs for young women and men; by (3) improving access to finance, including by exploring innovative forms of financing; and by (4) enhancing the capacities of the intermediary non-financial support structures and service providers, including in the areas of business development services, skills development, and health services, to support inclusive and sustainable entrepreneurship led by young women and men.
The proposed project is in line with both the Zambia-UNIDO Country Programme (2017-2021) and Zambia-UNFPA Country Programme (2016-2020), which encompass the Zambia United Nations Sustainable Development Partnership Framework (2016-2021). Moreover, the project will be implemented in line with the country’s 7th National Development Plan and COMESA’s Youth Programme, developed jointly with UNIDO, which aims to serve as a mechanism for the promotion of youth economic empowerment, as well as for improved social and political participation.
